peopleAlsoAsk.question: Are old cast irons worth anything?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The long lifespan of cast iron along with the growing demand for second-hand instead of new makes vintage cast iron a common find in the antique market. The value of antique cast iron skillets can start at similar to new prices, but a super rare Wagner or Griswold can fetch up to $1,500 apiece.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Cookware: How Can You Tell How Old a Cast Iron Skillet Is? - Uno Casa

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What to do with old irons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: By recycling your old iron at a local facility, you can be confident that it will be recycled safely and efficiently. Separate different types of metal: If you have a mix of different types of metal, it is important to separate them before recycling.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: What Can You Do With Old Iron? - Leinster Metal Recycling

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How old are antique irons?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The ones before 1880 are antique irons. The electric and the steam irons that are old are vintage.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Welcome to the fold: David Macpherson on antique irons

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What are antique irons called?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Prior to modern electric irons, many households used sad irons (also known as flat or smoothing irons) to remove wrinkles and unwanted creases from fabric.
